bioghist.p: The New Wilmington Mission Conference (NWMC) is a yearly meeting for youth aged 12 to 25 with an objective of deepening the missionary spirit and promoting service and witness for Jesus Christ. NWMC grew out of the ecumenical Young People's Missionary Movement. The first Conference was held in the summer of 1905 at Allegheny Theological Seminary in Pittsburgh. From 1906 until the present, the Conference has been held on the campus of Westminster College.

scopecontent.p: This collection documents the organization of and activities at the New Wilmington Mission Conference from 1910 to 2007. Materials include: minutes of the Conference's board of directors, 1910-2000; business manager's reports, 1959-1979; brochures and posters, 1923-2007; songsheets, 1946-2006; mission lectures and writings, 1960-2007; The Chatter newsletter, 1982-2000; newspaper articles about the Conference; a history of the Conference during Ed Fairman's years as director (in the 1980s); 75th and 100th anniversary publications; posters with photographs and text; mounted and unmounted panoramic photographs; and exhibit headers. Audiovisual documentation of the Conference includes: slides and accompanying scripts from 1966 and 2005; filmstrips with scripts, 1966-1987; 8mm and 16mm motion pictures, 1936-1954; videotapes and DVDs, 1989-2005; and a phonograph record, entitled "Days of Our Youth" (undated).
